alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 25 at 10:46PM PST until February 26 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in California... Santa Ynez River At Narrows affecting Santa Barbara County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding will continue through Sunday morning, due to releases from Lake Cachuma. * WHERE...Santa Ynez River At Narrows. * WHEN...Until late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding threatens agricultural land and outlying grounds of federal prison. At 15.0 feet, Flooding is a threat to lower Lompoc, especially around Floradale Ave. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM PST this evening, the stage was 15.7 feet. - Forecast...The river crested 1 pm Saturday at 17.8 feet. The river is expected to remain above 15 feet through at least Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.0 feet on 01/11/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 900 AM PST.
